properties.areaDesc: East Santa Barbara Channel from Pt. Conception to Pt. Mugu CA including Santa Cruz Island; Inner waters from Point Mugu to San Mateo Pt. CA including Santa Catalina and Anacapa Islands
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued January 5 at 4:56AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
By this afternoon, gusty northerly winds 15 to 25 knots with
local gusts to 35 knots will develop across the Santa Monica Basin
to the Ventura County Line. These winds will then shift to the
northeast later this evening at 15 to 25 knots with local gusts to
35 kt possible across the inner coastal waters from Ventura
southward to San Mateo Point are expected to persist through
Monday morning before slowly diminishing through Monday afternoon.
Winds will occasionally gust to 35 knots.

The gusty winds are expected to spread through the San Pedro
Channel out to Catalina Island. Strong northeast winds and choppy
northeast wind swell will affect the northeast facing harbors
of Catalina Island, including Avalon Harbor and Two Harbors.

These conditions have a history of vessel damage and loss of life.
Mariners should avoid these areas, or remain in safe harbor until
conditions improve. Avalon Harbor and Two Harbors should NOT be
considered safe harbor during this event.

NWSheadline: GUSTY NORTH WINDS WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE SANTA MONICA BAY THIS AFTERNOON THEN SHIFT TO THE NORTHEAST LATE THIS EVENING AND WILL AFFECT CATALINA ISLAND INCLUDING AVALON HARBOR
